Class KillCommand

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.KillCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class KillCommand extends Command implements Serializable
The KillCommand class represents a game command that targets and eliminates specific game elements located at certain coordinates. It extends the Command class to leverage standard command behaviors and implements Serializable to support serialization when needed. This class utilizes Jackson annotations to handle JSON serialization/deserialization and supports initialization with a set of coordinates where the kill actions should be applied.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • KillCommand

      public KillCommand()
      Default constructor for the KillCommand class. Initializes a new instance without any predefined parameters. This is primarily used for object creation in serialization/deserialization scenarios.

    • KillCommand

      public KillCommand(ArrayList<IntegerPair> coordinates, String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token)
      Constructs a KillCommand object with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - the list of IntegerPair objects representing the coordinates where the kill actions should be applied
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player initiating the command
      lv - the level associated with the command
      title - the title or name of the command
      token - the token used for authentication or validation

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(Player player) throws InterruptedException
      Executes the kill command for the specified player. This method targets specific game elements located at the coordinates associated with this command and performs the defined action to eliminate those elements from the game board.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      player - The player who initiated the command and will execute it.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the execution of the command is interrupted.

    • allowedIn

      public boolean allowedIn(PlayerState playerState)
      Determines whether the current command is allowed in the given player state. This method delegates the permission check to the provided PlayerState instance.
      Overrides:
      allowedIn in class Command
      Parameters:
      playerState - the current state of the player, used to determine if this command is allowed.
      Returns:
      true if the command is allowed in the provided player state, false otherwise.
